intro: Graffenrieda tricalcarata, commonly known as the three-ribbed graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
